suggestedQuestions: Show me some cool projects you've made
How did I make this site?

Show me some cool projects you've made: Absolutely! Azaria built TutorFlowAI, an AI-powered tutoring platform with real-time audio, a chatbot, and a digital whiteboard for smarter learning. He also contributed to Lichess, improving its UI and fixing bugs to make the chess experience smoother. Oh, and don’t forget WikiSurfer, a responsive website for exploring top Wikipedia articles with swipe gestures—perfect for curious minds!

Sure! Azaria worked on TutorFlowAI, combining AI and interactive tools to create a next-level tutoring experience. He also built a Remote Controlled Car with a custom 3D-printed chassis and Arduino integration. And then there’s Tetris in Assembly, where he coded a fully functional game with music and difficulty levels—because why not make assembly fun?

Of course! Azaria’s WikiSurfer project is a responsive site that makes exploring Wikipedia articles a breeze. He also contributed to Lichess, improving its UI and fixing bugs to enhance the chess platform. And let’s not forget SmartMeal, a Java-based recipe app that generates recipes based on ingredients and even creates grocery lists!

Let me tell you! Azaria created TutorFlowAI, an AI-driven tutoring platform with a chatbot and digital whiteboard. He also built a Remote Controlled Car using Arduino and 3D printing, and contributed to Lichess, where he improved the UI and fixed bugs to make chess even better. Oh, and there’s WikiSurfer, a site for exploring Wikipedia articles with ease!

Definitely! Azaria’s Tetris in Assembly is a fully functional game coded in MIPS Assembly, complete with music and difficulty levels. He also worked on SmartMeal, a recipe app that generates meal ideas and grocery lists. And then there’s TutorFlowAI, an AI-powered tutoring platform that combines real-time audio, a chatbot, and a digital whiteboard for smarter learning.

How did I make this site?: Great question! I built this site using React with Vite for a fast and efficient development process. For version control, I relied on Git and used Visual Studio Code as my IDE. To add some AI magic, I used Gemini and occasionally got a little help from Claude 3.5 Sonnet. It’s a mix of modern web development tools and a touch of AI collaboration!

This site came together with a combination of React and Vite, which made the development process smooth and snappy. I used Git for version control and Visual Studio Code as my trusty IDE. For the AI-powered features, I leaned on Gemini and occasionally consulted Claude 3.5 Sonnet. It’s a blend of solid coding tools and a little AI assistance.

I built this site using React with Vite to keep things fast and lightweight. For version control, I used Git, and my go-to IDE was Visual Studio Code.
